result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Court reviews criminal complaint with DEF.   Through Attorney DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.   Bond Continues.

COMBINED BOND  21CF23, 21CF34, 22CF89, 22CM56  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

Attny Pollak makes statement, and indicates DEF does qualifies for PD appointment.   Court addresses DEF, DEF responds.    State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Pollak argues bond.  DEF makes statement.  Court mutes DEF from jail, due to interruptions.  Court makes a detailed record of DEF missed appearances in cases.   Court sets bond.
